infoData.uno5: Delivery: Traditional classroom (Now online cuz Covid-19)
infoData.tres1: Instructor: Barry A. Cumbie, Ph.D.Associate Professor, Department of Computer Science & Information Systems
infoData.tres2: Associate Professor, Department of Computer Science & Information Systems
infoData.tres3: Salutation: Dr. Cumbie or Professor Cumbie
infoData.cuatro1: A fundamental  course  in  Web  Development  utilizing  contemporary  standards,  methods,  and tools  for  students  to  develop  skills  in  creating  and  deploying  web-based  content. Students learn development concepts spanning markup and programming languages and libraries, local and hosted environments, versioning control systems, and development tools.
infoData.learnsub: The objectives of this course are for students to:
infoData.learn1: Relate web development concepts and terminology.
infoData.learn2: Demonstrate the usage of web development technologies.
infoData.learn4: Determine deficiencies in web-based interface design.
